problem_statement: The engineering challenge lies in the implementation of a rigid Asynchronous Finite State Machine where transition logic is governed by a complex hierarchy of constraints rather than simple sequence. Unlike standard web logic, traffic systems function as
software; the model must prioritize the
clearance interval (where all lights are red for 2 seconds to clear the intersection) above all else during a handover. Mid-tier models typically fail in two specific areas:
where they switch immediately from Green to Red upon receiving an emergency signal (causing a virtual crash), and
where the logic fails to revert to the normal cycle after the emergency signal is lifted, leaving the intersection frozen in the preemption state.
